1.definition: inherently, strictly, or by operation of statute, constitutional provision or doctrine, or case law [the transaction was illegal] see alsoatat

2.definition: without proof of special damages or reference to extrinsic circumstances [defamatory statements that were actionable] compareadjbeing such inherently, clearly, or by operation of statute, constitutional provision or doctrine, or case law [it is clear that licensing of adult entertainment establishments is not aviolation of the First Amendment ", 457 S.E.2d 816 (1995)"] [aconflict of interest]
